result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Maguel D Goodlow

records.addlTxt: Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO COMMISSIONER.  Court takes no action on bail at this time.
Defendant Maguel D Goodlow not in court.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.

Defendant Maguel D Goodlow in court without counsel.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Maguel D Goodlow appeared by video means. Defendant is not eligible for SPD counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for indigency hearing in Branch 37.  Indigency hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.

Oral No Contact Order with D.L. and L.G.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Maguel D Goodlow in court.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/18/2022@2:00pm
